revisions.rev:
'''Sex-selective abortion''' is the practice of aborting a fetus after a determination by ultrasound that the fetus is a certain sex (usually female). It is believed to be responsible for at least part of the skewed birth statistics in favor of males in Mainland China, India, Taiwan, and South Korea. Although the practice is often illegal, laws against it are extremely difficult to enforce.
The cause of sex-selective abortion are social in that a male is necessary to carry on the family name and economic in that a male can work in the fields and generate more income than females. Another contributing factor is the wide availablity of [[ultrasound]] in rural areas which makes it possible to determine gender before birth.
